title.narrative: Public Financial Management Strengthening Project (PFMSP)

description.narrative: (Nepal): PFMSP provides technical analysis and design support to the GON to strengthen the transparency and accountability of public financial management systems at the Ministry of Finance; Ministry of Education, Science and Technology; the Ministry of Health and Population (MOHP); and the National Reconstruction Authority. Interventions target three key goals: enhanced budget planning and management capacity; improved financial controls and procurement mechanisms within line ministries; and strengthened PFM. These results will be achieved through technical assistance in support of the GON's procurement processes and strengthened budget management through provision of hardware, software, and trainings to GON staff. The implementing partner is a recognized leader in providing financial solutions for institutions. PFMSP's interventions play an important role in mitigating the increased risks of corruption, money laundering and financial mismanagement under Nepal's new federal structure. As an example, PFMSP's engagement with the MOHP will improve financial systems for the GON's water & sanitation programs. Institutional capacity development with line ministries and the establishment of robust PFM systems at the sub-national level will promote government accountability and transparency, reduce the risk of corruption and mismanagement, and ensure resources are channeled towards local development that benefits citizens. Through improved financial controls and strengthened government transparency and accountability, the activity will advance governance goals of the Indo-Pacific Strategy and help transition Nepal into a partner that can better support an accountable and rules-based order. PFMSP is crucial to advancing U.S. interests in Nepal as expressed in ICS sub-objective 3.2.3: "U.S. Mission engages with the GON to build the incentives and skills required to help Nepal begin its transition from a large-scale aid recipient to a more self-reliant partner.". ..

Objectives for Nepal: The PFMSP is designed to reduce fiduciary risks by strengthening supply-side financial accountability and to strengthen internal oversight and accountability mechanisms. PFMSP will enhance the transparency and accountability of the PFM systems of GON ministries and agencies. PFMSP will support the GON’s capacity building priorities, by extensive consultations between USAID, GON and the donor community. The geographic scope will be USAID/Nepal’s 20 focus districts in the West, Mid-West and Far-West regions, as well as the 14 earthquake affected districts.
